trans-unit.source: How to test a driver at runtime using Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: How to test a driver at runtime using Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: The WDK extensions to Visual Studio provide a device testing interface that enables you to conveniently build, deploy, install, and test a driver on a test computer on your network.
trans-unit.target: The WDK extensions to Visual Studio provide a device testing interface that enables you to conveniently build, deploy, install, and test a driver on a test computer on your network.

trans-unit.source: The WDK provides a collection of device driver tests that you can use to test the features and functions of your driver.
trans-unit.target: The WDK provides a collection of device driver tests that you can use to test the features and functions of your driver.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: A Driver Package that is ready to install.
trans-unit.target: A Driver Package that is ready to install.

trans-unit.source: You must first create and build your driver and then create a Driver Package for installation.
trans-unit.target: You must first create and build your driver and then create a Driver Package for installation.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Building a Driver](building_a_driver.md) and [Creating a Driver Package](creating_a_driver_package.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Building a Driver](building_a_driver.md) and [Creating a Driver Package](creating_a_driver_package.md).

trans-unit.source: The driver must be test signed.
trans-unit.target: The driver must be test signed.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Signing a Driver](signing_a_driver.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Signing a Driver](signing_a_driver.md).

trans-unit.source: A test computer (or computers).
trans-unit.target: A test computer (or computers).

trans-unit.source: The test computer must be on the same network as the computer that you are using for development.
trans-unit.target: The test computer must be on the same network as the computer that you are using for development.

trans-unit.source: Both computers must be connected to the same domain, or both connected to the network under the same workgroup.
trans-unit.target: Both computers must be connected to the same domain, or both connected to the network under the same workgroup.

trans-unit.source: The test computer should be running the version of Windows that you want to target for testing.
trans-unit.target: The test computer should be running the version of Windows that you want to target for testing.

trans-unit.source: You can also [install a checked build](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff547205) or partial checked build of Windows for testing and debugging purposes.
trans-unit.target: You can also [install a checked build](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff547205) or partial checked build of Windows for testing and debugging purposes.

trans-unit.source: A device to be tested.
trans-unit.target: A device to be tested.

trans-unit.source: (*Recommended*) Set up a kernel mode debugging connection to the test computer.
trans-unit.target: (*Recommended*) Set up a kernel mode debugging connection to the test computer.

trans-unit.source: To use a network connection for kernel mode debugging, the target computer must be running Windows 8.
trans-unit.target: To use a network connection for kernel mode debugging, the target computer must be running Windows 8.

trans-unit.source: On computers running Windows 7 or Windows Vista, you can set up a USB, 1394, or a serial connection for kernel mode debugging.
trans-unit.target: On computers running Windows 7 or Windows Vista, you can set up a USB, 1394, or a serial connection for kernel mode debugging.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 8.1)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Dn745909).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 8.1)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Dn745909).

trans-unit.source: Instructions
trans-unit.target: Instructions

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Configure computers for testing
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Configure computers for testing

trans-unit.source: From Visual Studio, you can configure and provision computers for testing.
trans-unit.target: From Visual Studio, you can configure and provision computers for testing.

trans-unit.source: When you configure the test computers, the WDK driver test framework automatically enables the test computer for remote debugging and transfers the necessary test binaries and support files.
trans-unit.target: When you configure the test computers, the WDK driver test framework automatically enables the test computer for remote debugging and transfers the necessary test binaries and support files.

trans-unit.source: If you have not already done so, follow the instructions to [Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 8.1)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Dn745909).
trans-unit.target: If you have not already done so, follow the instructions to [Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 8.1)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Dn745909).

trans-unit.source: Connect the device that you want to test to the test computer or computers.
trans-unit.target: Connect the device that you want to test to the test computer or computers.

trans-unit.source: After you have configured and provisioned a test computer, you can use Visual Studio to deploy drivers, schedule tests, and debug drivers on the test computer.
trans-unit.target: After you have configured and provisioned a test computer, you can use Visual Studio to deploy drivers, schedule tests, and debug drivers on the test computer.

trans-unit.source: For information about deployment and about how you can deploy a driver automatically at build time, see [Deploying a Driver to a Test Computer](deploying_a_driver_to_a_test_computer.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about deployment and about how you can deploy a driver automatically at build time, see [Deploying a Driver to a Test Computer](deploying_a_driver_to_a_test_computer.md).

trans-unit.source: You can also enable and set options for [Driver Verifier](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff545448), the runtime verification tool for drivers.
trans-unit.target: You can also enable and set options for [Driver Verifier](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff545448), the runtime verification tool for drivers.

trans-unit.source: Driver Verifier monitors your driver as you run tests on the test computer.
trans-unit.target: Driver Verifier monitors your driver as you run tests on the test computer.

trans-unit.source: For information about setting the Driver Verifier options for deployment, see [Driver Verifier Properties for Driver Projects](driver_verifier_properties_for__driver_projects.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about setting the Driver Verifier options for deployment, see [Driver Verifier Properties for Driver Projects](driver_verifier_properties_for__driver_projects.md).

trans-unit.source: You can also run tests outside of Visual Studio, for more information see [How to test a driver at runtime from a Command Prompt](how_to_test_a_driver_at_runtime_from_a_command_prompt.md).
trans-unit.target: You can also run tests outside of Visual Studio, for more information see [How to test a driver at runtime from a Command Prompt](how_to_test_a_driver_at_runtime_from_a_command_prompt.md).

trans-unit.source: Starting in WDK 8.1, you can copy and run the HCK Test Suites on test computers using command scripts.
trans-unit.target: Starting in WDK 8.1, you can copy and run the HCK Test Suites on test computers using command scripts.

trans-unit.source: See [How to run the HCK Test Suites in WDK 8.1](run_the_hck_test_suites_in_the_wdk.md).
trans-unit.target: See [How to run the HCK Test Suites in WDK 8.1](run_the_hck_test_suites_in_the_wdk.md).

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Select an HCK Test Suite to run on the test computer (using WDK 8.1)
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Select an HCK Test Suite to run on the test computer (using WDK 8.1)

trans-unit.source: Starting with WDK 8.1, you can select HCK Test Suites to run on the test computer.
trans-unit.target: Starting with WDK 8.1, you can select HCK Test Suites to run on the test computer.

trans-unit.source: The HCK Test Suites include the [Device Fundamentals Tests](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/JJ673011), and Windows Hardware Certification kit (HCK) Basic tests for graphics, imaging, wireless LAN, mobile broadband (CDMA and GSM), and WiFi Direct devices.
trans-unit.target: The HCK Test Suites include the [Device Fundamentals Tests](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/JJ673011), and Windows Hardware Certification kit (HCK) Basic tests for graphics, imaging, wireless LAN, mobile broadband (CDMA and GSM), and WiFi Direct devices.

trans-unit.source: See [How to run the HCK Test Suites in WDK 8.1](run_the_hck_test_suites_in_the_wdk.md).
trans-unit.target: See [How to run the HCK Test Suites in WDK 8.1](run_the_hck_test_suites_in_the_wdk.md).

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Select the tests to run on the test computer (WDK 8 and WDK 8.1)
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Select the tests to run on the test computer (WDK 8 and WDK 8.1)

trans-unit.source: To make driver testing on different test targets easier, tests are scheduled to run against test systems in units called *test groups*.
trans-unit.target: To make driver testing on different test targets easier, tests are scheduled to run against test systems in units called *test groups*.

trans-unit.source: A driver test group is a collection of tests that you select to run on the test computer.
trans-unit.target: A driver test group is a collection of tests that you select to run on the test computer.

trans-unit.source: The driver test groups help you organize your tests and test results from each test pass.
trans-unit.target: The driver test groups help you organize your tests and test results from each test pass.

trans-unit.source: You can save your test results to separate folders.
trans-unit.target: You can save your test results to separate folders.

trans-unit.source: You can create and manage test groups, change parameters passed to the tests in the test groups, and schedule them to run against your test systems.
trans-unit.target: You can create and manage test groups, change parameters passed to the tests in the test groups, and schedule them to run against your test systems.

trans-unit.source: From the **Driver** menu, click **Test** and then select **Test Group Explorer**.
trans-unit.target: From the **Driver** menu, click **Test** and then select **Test Group Explorer**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Driver Test Group Explorer** window, click the **Create a new test group** button.
trans-unit.target: In the **Driver Test Group Explorer** window, click the **Create a new test group** button.

trans-unit.source: Or, click **New Test Group** from the **Driver** menu.
trans-unit.target: Or, click **New Test Group** from the **Driver** menu.

trans-unit.source: In the **Driver Test Group** window for the group that you created, type a name in **Test Group Name** text box to identify the group.
trans-unit.target: In the **Driver Test Group** window for the group that you created, type a name in **Test Group Name** text box to identify the group.

trans-unit.source: The default name is Driver Test Group\_*nnnnn*, where *nnnnn* represents the number of the test group
trans-unit.target: The default name is Driver Test Group\_*nnnnn*, where *nnnnn* represents the number of the test group

trans-unit.source: Click **Add/Remove Tests**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add/Remove Tests**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Add or Remove Driver Tests** dialog box, you can specify the driver test category and architecture (All, x86, x64, ARM).
trans-unit.target: In the **Add or Remove Driver Tests** dialog box, you can specify the driver test category and architecture (All, x86, x64, ARM).

trans-unit.source: By default all tests are shown.
trans-unit.target: By default all tests are shown.

trans-unit.source: To view the test categories, click the folders in the Driver Test Categories drop-down list.
trans-unit.target: To view the test categories, click the folders in the Driver Test Categories drop-down list.

trans-unit.source: For example, in WDK 8, to select all of the Device Fundamentals tests that are used in the [Windows Hardware Certification Kit (HCK)](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=254893), click **All Tests**, **Certification**, and **Device Fundamentals**.
trans-unit.target: For example, in WDK 8, to select all of the Device Fundamentals tests that are used in the [Windows Hardware Certification Kit (HCK)](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=254893), click **All Tests**, **Certification**, and **Device Fundamentals**.

trans-unit.source: For information about the tests, see [How to select and configure the Device Fundamentals Tests](how_to_select_and_configure_the_device_fundamental_tests.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about the tests, see [How to select and configure the Device Fundamentals Tests](how_to_select_and_configure_the_device_fundamental_tests.md).

trans-unit.source: In WDK 8.1, the Device Fundamentals tests are under **All Tests**, **HCK Tests**, **Certification**, and **Device Fundamentals** folder.
trans-unit.target: In WDK 8.1, the Device Fundamentals tests are under **All Tests**, **HCK Tests**, **Certification**, and **Device Fundamentals** folder.

trans-unit.source: In WDK 8.1 the Driver Test Categories include the HCK (Basic) Tests.
trans-unit.target: In WDK 8.1 the Driver Test Categories include the HCK (Basic) Tests.

trans-unit.source: See [How to run the HCK Test Suites in WDK 8.1](run_the_hck_test_suites_in_the_wdk.md) for more information.
trans-unit.target: See [How to run the HCK Test Suites in WDK 8.1](run_the_hck_test_suites_in_the_wdk.md) for more information.

trans-unit.source: Be sure that you select the tests that match the architecture of the intended test computer (x86, x64, ARM).
trans-unit.target: Be sure that you select the tests that match the architecture of the intended test computer (x86, x64, ARM).

trans-unit.source: Use the **Architecture Filter** to show only those tests that will run on your test computer.
trans-unit.target: Use the **Architecture Filter** to show only those tests that will run on your test computer.

trans-unit.source: Click **>>** to add the selected tests.
trans-unit.target: Click **>>** to add the selected tests.

trans-unit.source: Step 4: Configure test parameters
trans-unit.target: Step 4: Configure test parameters

trans-unit.source: After you select the tests for your test group, you can configure any of the runtime parameters that are passed to the driver tests.
trans-unit.target: After you select the tests for your test group, you can configure any of the runtime parameters that are passed to the driver tests.

trans-unit.source: For example, many of the Device Fundamentals Tests have a parameter *DQ*, which stands for Device Query.
trans-unit.target: For example, many of the Device Fundamentals Tests have a parameter *DQ*, which stands for Device Query.

trans-unit.source: This is a [Simple Data Evaluation Language](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff539607) (SDEL) query.
trans-unit.target: This is a [Simple Data Evaluation Language](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff539607) (SDEL) query.

trans-unit.source: The [Windows Driver Test Framework](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff539547) provides SDEL as a query language to simplify the task of collecting targets based on attributes or relationships.
trans-unit.target: The [Windows Driver Test Framework](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff539547) provides SDEL as a query language to simplify the task of collecting targets based on attributes or relationships.

trans-unit.source: For example, to run the tests for USB devices only, use the device query: class='usb'.
trans-unit.target: For example, to run the tests for USB devices only, use the device query: class='usb'.

trans-unit.source: You can change the value of each test parameter in the test group.
trans-unit.target: You can change the value of each test parameter in the test group.

trans-unit.source: You can view and edit the all of the runtime test parameters for a test by clicking on the name of the test in the **Driver Test Group** window.
trans-unit.target: You can view and edit the all of the runtime test parameters for a test by clicking on the name of the test in the **Driver Test Group** window.

trans-unit.source: The **Driver Test Group** window provides a description of the selected test and also provides a description of the test parameters that you select.
trans-unit.target: The **Driver Test Group** window provides a description of the selected test and also provides a description of the test parameters that you select.

trans-unit.source: For information about setting the test parameters, see [How to select and configure the Device Fundamentals Tests](how_to_select_and_configure_the_device_fundamental_tests.md)
trans-unit.target: For information about setting the test parameters, see [How to select and configure the Device Fundamentals Tests](how_to_select_and_configure_the_device_fundamental_tests.md)

trans-unit.source: After you select the tests, set the parameters, and name the group, click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: After you select the tests, set the parameters, and name the group, click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: When you save the test group, the test group will become the currently selected test group, and the name of the test group will appear in the Driver Test toolbar.
trans-unit.target: When you save the test group, the test group will become the currently selected test group, and the name of the test group will appear in the Driver Test toolbar.

trans-unit.source: You can now run tests against the currently selected remote test computer (also shown in the Driver Test toolbar).
trans-unit.target: You can now run tests against the currently selected remote test computer (also shown in the Driver Test toolbar).

trans-unit.source: Step 5: Build and deploy the driver
trans-unit.target: Step 5: Build and deploy the driver

trans-unit.source: From the **Build** menu, click **Deploy Solution**.
trans-unit.target: From the **Build** menu, click **Deploy Solution**.

trans-unit.source: For information about deploying a driver automatically at build time, see [Deploying a Driver to a Test Computer](deploying_a_driver_to_a_test_computer.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about deploying a driver automatically at build time, see [Deploying a Driver to a Test Computer](deploying_a_driver_to_a_test_computer.md).

trans-unit.source: For information about automatically setting the Driver Verifier options on the test computer, see [Driver Verifier Properties for Driver Projects](driver_verifier_properties_for__driver_projects.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about automatically setting the Driver Verifier options on the test computer, see [Driver Verifier Properties for Driver Projects](driver_verifier_properties_for__driver_projects.md).

trans-unit.source: You should always enable Driver Verifier on your test computer.
trans-unit.target: You should always enable Driver Verifier on your test computer.

trans-unit.source: Step 6: Run the tests on the test computer
trans-unit.target: Step 6: Run the tests on the test computer

trans-unit.source: From the **Driver** menu, click **Test > Run test**.
trans-unit.target: From the **Driver** menu, click **Test > Run test**.

trans-unit.source: By default, the Run test command runs all of the tests in the currently selected test group.
trans-unit.target: By default, the Run test command runs all of the tests in the currently selected test group.

trans-unit.source: Remarks
trans-unit.target: Remarks

trans-unit.source: For information about the driver tests and test categories, see [How to select and configure the Device Fundamentals Tests](how_to_select_and_configure_the_device_fundamental_tests.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about the driver tests and test categories, see [How to select and configure the Device Fundamentals Tests](how_to_select_and_configure_the_device_fundamental_tests.md).

trans-unit.source: For information about the testing framework, see [Test Authoring and Execution Framework](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh439725) (TAEF) and [Windows Driver Test Framework](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff539547) (WDTF).
trans-unit.target: For information about the testing framework, see [Test Authoring and Execution Framework](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh439725) (TAEF) and [Windows Driver Test Framework](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff539547) (WDTF).

trans-unit.source: You can write your own driver tests and deploy those tests on test computers.
trans-unit.target: You can write your own driver tests and deploy those tests on test computers.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [How to write a driver test](how_to_write_a_driver_test_.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [How to write a driver test](how_to_write_a_driver_test_.md).

trans-unit.source: Running the Device Fundamentals tests in Visual Studio early in the development cycle will help you when are finally ready to test your driver using the [Windows Hardware Certification Kit (HCK)](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=254893).
trans-unit.target: Running the Device Fundamentals tests in Visual Studio early in the development cycle will help you when are finally ready to test your driver using the [Windows Hardware Certification Kit (HCK)](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=254893).

trans-unit.target: Related topics

trans-unit.target: [Setting Up Kernel-Mode Debugging in Visual Studio](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/hardware/hh439376
